title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable description. Acceptable descriptions include the following.

· It has an active site/a shape that can bind with the substrate(s)/brings reactants together.

· It has a charge that is compatible with the substrate(s).

The response includes an acceptable description. Acceptable descriptions include the following.

· It has an active site/a shape that can bind with the substrate(s)/brings reactants together.

· It has a charge that is compatible with the substrate(s).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the dependent variable as the amount of light emitted.
The response identifies the dependent variable as the amount of light emitted.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state the null hypothesis that temperature has no effect on the amount of light emitted.
The response states the null hypothesis that temperature has no effect on the amount of light emitted.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include support for the student’s claim. Acceptable support includes the following.

· Higher temperature increases the frequency of collisions/interactions between molecules, resulting in an increase in reaction rate.

· The higher temperature results in a change to the active site that enhances substrate binding.

The response includes support for the student’s claim. Acceptable support includes the following.

· Higher temperature increases the frequency of collisions/interactions between molecules, resulting in an increase in reaction rate.

· The higher temperature results in a change to the active site that enhances substrate binding.
